children.name: Last updated
children.description: Date when the propensity or the reaction event was updated.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Category
children.description: Category of the identified 'Substance'.

defining_code.description: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body, such as peanut or egg.
Any substance administered to achieve a physiological effect.
Any other substance encountered including venom, latex and other environmental substances.

children.name: Causative agent
children.description: Identification of a substance, or substance class, that is considered to put the individual at risk of an adverse reaction event.

children.name: Criticality
children.description: An indication of the potential for critical system organ damage or life threatening consequence.

defining_code.description: Exposure to substance unlikely to result in critical system organ damage or life threatening consequence. Future exposure to the identified 'Substance' should be considered a relative contra-indication in normal clinical circumstances.

Exposure to substance may result in critical organ system damage or life threatening consequence. Future exposure to the identified 'Substance' should be considered an absolute contra-indication in normal clinical circumstances.
Unable to assess with information available.

children.name: Reaction mechanism
children.description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the adverse reaction.

defining_code.description: Immune mediated reaction, including allergic reactions and hypersensitivities.
A non-immune mediated reaction, which can include pseudo-allergic reactions, side effects, intolerances, drug toxicities (for example, to Gentamicin).
The physiological mechanism could not be determined.

children.name: Comment
children.description: Additional narrative about the propensity for the adverse reaction, not captured in other fields.

children.name: Onset of last reaction
children.description: The date and/or time of the onset of the last known occurrence of a reaction event.

children.name: Onset of reaction
children.description: Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the reaction.

children.name: Route of exposure
children.description: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the identified 'Specific substance'.

children.name: Manifestation
children.description: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction.

children.name: Specific substance
children.description: Identification of the substance considered to be responsible for the specific adverse reaction event.

children.name: Certainty
children.description: Statement about the degree of clinical certainty that the identified 'Specific substance' was the cause of the 'Manifestation' in this reaction event.

defining_code.description: A low level of clinical certainty that the reaction was caused by the identified 'Specific substance'.
A reasonable level of clinical certainty that the reaction was caused by the identified 'Specific substance'.
A high level of clinical certainty that the reaction was due to the identified 'Substance', which may include clinical evidence by testing or re-challenge.

children.name: Comment
children.description: Additional narrative about the adverse reaction event not captured in other fields.

children.name: Reaction description
children.description: Narrative description about the adverse reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.

children.name: Severity
children.description: Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

defining_code.description: Causes mild physiological effects.
Causes moderate physiological effects.
Causes severe physiological effects.

children.name: Reaction details
children.description: Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified 'Substance'.

children.name: Status
children.description: Assertion about the certainty of the propensity, or potential future risk, of the identified 'Substance' to cause a reaction.

defining_code.description: A low level of clinical certainty about the propensity of a reaction to the identified 'Substance'.
A reasonable level of certainty about the propensity for a reaction to the identified 'Substance'.
A high level of certainty about the propensity for a reaction to the identified 'Substance', which may include clinical evidence by testing or re-challenge.
The previously known reaction to the identified 'Substance' has been clinically reassessed and considered no longer to be an active risk.
The propensity for a reaction to the identified 'Substance' has been clinically reassessed or has been disproved with a high level of clinical certainty by re-exposure or deliberate challenge.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Adverse reaction risk
children.description: Risk of harmful or undesirable physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.

children.name: Allergies and adverse reactions
children.description: Allergies and adverse reactions heading (AoMRC).

tree.name: Adverse reaction list
tree.description: A persistent and managed list of adverse reactions experienced by the subject that may influence clinical decision-making and care provision.
